snippet: The Central Park horse carriage industry would be significantly reduced and pedicabs would be prohibited from operating below 85th Street under a deal announced late Sunday by the de Blasio administration.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration announces agreement to reduce Central Park horse carriage industry, as part of effort to fulfill de Blasio's longstanding campaign promise; deal will reduce number of horses from about 220 to 95 by 2018 and will require new stable be built in Central Park.
lead_paragraph: The Central Park horse carriage industry would be significantly reduced and pedicabs would be prohibited from operating below 85th Street under a deal announced late Sunday by the de Blasio administration.

headline.main: New York City Announces Deal on Carriage Horses in Central Park
headline.print_headline: City Announces Deal on Carriage Horses in Central Park
